snippet: In an effort to crack down on drug abuse, most patients at the 11 hospitals will no longer be able to get more than three days’ worth of narcotic painkillers like Vicodin and Percocet.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg announces that emergency rooms at New York City's 11 public hospitals will sharply restrict use of some of the most common and powerful prescription painkillers on the market; city officials say move is effort to crack down on citywide and national epidemic of prescription drug abuse.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to crack down on drug abuse, most patients at the 11 hospitals will no longer be able to get more than three days’ worth of narcotic painkillers like Vicodin and Percocet.

headline.seo: New York City to Restrict Powerful Prescription Drugs in Public Hospitals’ Emergency Rooms
